instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with a hot CPU. Fan spins once.
threads.message:
Hi,

That's my first post on this forum, and having big hopes about it ;-)
Kidding...

So I have that <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board which starts but only get the fan spinning once. Then full blast and I feel that the CPU is getting too fast.
I've the CPU rail <SIGNAL>PPVVC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> which is a stable 1.78V (I was hoping for a higher voltage by a bad regulator or transistors)

I would replace the Bios chip or the clock chip but I will check that first.

However, I have a basic question since I have a few other <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with burning CPUs... should we assume CPU is dead if it's boiling or is there still hope?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with a hot CPU. Fan spins once.
threads.message: History, liquid? Inspect corroded resistors/traces around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>. Also pin 8 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with a hot CPU. Fan spins once.
threads.message:
Hi Duke,

Thanks! It was a broken trace between the quartz and the clock chip.
3 cycles fan spin restored and board alive now.

cheers!
